meanings.definition: Discarded or old items that are considered useless or of little value.
meanings.sent1: The pile of junks in the corner needs to be thrown away.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a lot of junks for sale at cheap prices.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sell his broken watch as a valuable antique, but everyone knew it was just junks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was cluttered with junks of negative thoughts that she needed to clear out.
meanings.sent5: The old attic was filled with dusty junks from decades ago.

meanings.definition: A type of Chinese sailing ship with distinctive sails and hull design.
meanings.sent1: The museum had a beautiful model of a traditional junks on display.
meanings.sent2: The junks sailed gracefully across the calm waters of the bay.
meanings.sent3: The pirates were surprised to see a fleet of junks approaching their ship.
meanings.sent4: The junks glided through the sea like a swan through a pond.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to raise the sails of the junks before setting off on their voyage.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something as worthless or unnecessary.
meanings.sent1: She decided to junks all the old papers cluttering her desk.
meanings.sent2: After the party, they had to junks the leftover food that no one wanted.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to junks his friend's favorite shirt if he didn't stop wearing it.
meanings.sent4: The company had to junks the outdated technology to make room for new innovations.
meanings.sent5: In order to declutter her home, she had to junks many sentimental items she no longer needed.
